Key Match Events: Mahmoud Alaswad scored the opening goal after a play from Daleho Irandust.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made a save from Noah Shamoun's close-range shot.
Syria hit the bar through Irandust.
An avoidable goal was scored on the counter-attack due to poor positioning by Anwar Ali and Subhasish Bose.
Pablo Sabbag scored the third goal through a clinical break after India attacked.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Manolo Marquez was angry with the first half and criticized the team's lack of bravery.
Marquez acknowledged that India deserved at least a goal for their efforts.
India's quest for their first win of the year continues with upcoming matches against Vietnam and Lebanon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India created 18 shots, four more than Syria.
India had more possession than Syria.
